configuration.dashboardSubtitle: Comprehensive Analysis of Research Impact, Global Standing, and Institutional Contributions

summary.title: Overview
insights: India demonstrates significant research leadership with 50 accepted papers at ICLR 2025, ranking 6th globally and representing 1.3% of all conference contributions.
Quality indicators remain competitive with a 10.0% spotlight rate and 4.0% oral presentation rate, though opportunities exist to enhance high-impact research visibility.
Strong research autonomy is evident through 52% first-author papers and 46% majority-author collaborations, indicating robust indigenous research capabilities.
A balanced research ecosystem emerges from 28 contributing institutions—17 academic and 11 corporate—fostering diverse perspectives in machine learning advancement.

context.title: Global Context
context.subtitle: How India's ML Research output compares globally
insights: India holds 16th position globally, following the United States (1,929 papers), China (1,308), Hong Kong (294), United Kingdom (293), and Canada (255).
India's research quality metrics align closely with global standards: spotlight rates of 10.0% versus 10.5% global average, demonstrating consistent research excellence.
Within the Asia-Pacific region, India trails China and Hong Kong but maintains a substantial presence, contributing meaningfully to the global machine learning discourse.

focusCountry.title: India's Research Portfolio: Depth, Breadth, and Leadership
focusCountry.subtitle: Examining authorship patterns, collaboration networks, and research quality indicators.
insights: India's 133 participating researchers produced work spanning diverse machine learning domains, with 5 spotlight papers and 2 oral presentations showcasing cutting-edge contributions.

Research leadership metrics indicate strong indigenous capabilities: 26 first-author papers and 23 majority-author collaborations demonstrate India's growing role as a research originator rather than just contributor.
The institutional diversity—spanning premier IITs, specialized research institutes, and innovative corporate labs—reflects a mature and interconnected research ecosystem.
Strategic opportunities exist to increase oral presentation rates from 4.0% to match global standards of 6.1%, potentially through enhanced international collaboration and methodological rigor.

institutions.title: Institutional Research Excellence: Building India's ML Ecosystem
institutions.subtitle: Analyzing institutional contributions, research impact, and the academic-industry collaboration framework.
insights: IIT Bombay leads institutional contributions with 10 papers including 1 spotlight, demonstrating sustained research excellence and establishing itself as a premier ML research hub.
The 17 academic institutions collectively outpace 11 corporate entities in paper volume, while corporate labs contribute valuable applied research perspectives essential for technology transfer.
Multi-institutional collaborations and diverse research themes—from theoretical foundations to practical applications—position India's ML ecosystem for continued growth and international recognition.

Emerging corporate research labs and specialized AI companies complement traditional academic powerhouses, creating a dynamic innovation landscape that bridges fundamental research with industry applications.
